name: Osmoreceptors - Osmolality
question1: What is an osmole?  What is Osmolarity?  What is Osmolality?
contents:
An osmole - is an amount of solute that exerts an osmotic pressure of 1ATM when placed in 22.4L of solution at 0°C

→ osmotic pressure of 1 atmosphere is produced when 1mol of solute particles are contained within 22.4L at 0°C


Osmolarity - number of osmoles per litre (problem with using this is changes in volume of solvent (water) with changes in temperature)


Osmolality - number of osmoles per kg. (independent of changes in temperature) 

  • Measured directly by the depression of freezing point. 
  • Normal plasma osmolality 280-300mosm/kg 
  • Osmolality and osmolarity often used interchangeably although plasma proteins and fats give rise to a small difference (ie, extra beyond the Na+/K+ Urea and glucose)
  • (osmolality > osmolarity-  ie, amount in kg > amount in L)


  • Osmolality (mosm/kg) can  be estimated by 2[(Na+) + (K+)] + [urea] + [glucose] 
  • Osmolar gap - difference between measured and calculated - ↑ by osmotically active particles (eg ETOH, glycine (TURP syndrome)) 


1 mole of Na+Cl- dissolve in water completely dissociates into Na+ and Cl- ions; that is 2 Osmol of osmotically active particles.
question2: What are the body’s osmoreceptors?  What are the actions of vasopressin (antidiuretic hormone, ADH)?
contents2:
These are cells of the anterior hypothalamus, located outside the blood–brain barrier.

They respond to changes in osmolality and stimulate thirst and the secretion of vasopressin (ADH)



ADH stimulates V2 receptors on collecting ducts, which increases adenylate cyclase activity.

This causes fusion of pre-formed water channels on the apical membrane resulting in increased permeability of the collecting ducts to water.

Other ADH effects include: (SCRAP GBS)

  • S timulates thirst
  • R elease of factor VIII by the endothelium
  • A rteriolar vasoconstriction
  • P latelet aggregation and degranulation

  • G lycogenolysis in the liver
  • B rain neurotransmitter
  • S ecretion of ACTH from the anterior pituitary gland.
